creator: rl@math.technion.ac.il
text:
In apache_1.3.28, running a cgi with suEXEC has a problem to identify SSL
connections using the normal enviroment HTTPS=on setting, since suexec.c in
this distribution (in line 137) has in the safe variable list the string
"HTTPS_" for a prefix, and doesn't have the string "HTTPS=". This has been
fixed in apache 2, but can you please also fix it in apache 1.3?

creator: rl@math.technion.ac.il
text:
Created attachment 8062
patch to suexec.c fixiing HTTPS=on problem

Two points.
1) Your patch is utterly bogus - you're knocking every HTTPS_ variable out of
the safe list. Also, HTTPS= will never match - the env variable is HTTPS.
2) We don't ship a patch for suexec to support SSL - you need to talk to either
the apache-ssl folks or the mod-ssl folks.
creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
rl@math.technion.ac.il
text:
1) My patch is comletely correct. It is also verified with the Apache 2.0 code.
There are no HTTPS_ variables, just HTTP_ and SSL_. It will match with the
string HTTPS= generated by a printenv command. I installed this patch and it works.

2) I was not aware of the fact that mod_ssl modigies suexec. Ill notify mod-ssl
list (I hope they will be more polite ;-)
